vocab.def: University for the Deaf in Washington, D.C.; often fingerspelled 'G-U'.
National Association of the Deaf; fingerspelled N-A-D.
1988 protest at Gallaudet; often fingerspelled D-P-N.
Flat hands move forward, showing equality/rights.
Claw hands shake up-down or fists raise upward.
H-hand moves back-and-forth at shoulder level.

sections.heading: Warm-Up: History Signs
sections.body: Drill **HISTORY, RIGHTS, PROTEST, EQUAL**. Keep motions clear. Use serious/proper NMM (respectful tone).

microCheck.q: Which sign shows fairness or equal rights?

sections.heading: Partner Practice: Mini History Share
sections.body: Partner A: share 1 event (e.g., DPN, NAD). Partner B: ask **WHY IMPORTANT?** Partner A: short reason (e.g., **BECAUSE RIGHTS IMPROVE.**). Swap roles.

sections.heading: Mini-Showcase
sections.body: Record **15â€“20s**: sign one Deaf history highlight + reason. Example: **1988 GALLAUDET PROTEST. DEAF PRESIDENT NOW. IMPORTANT BECAUSE COMMUNITY STRONG.**
